intro: Tapeinostemon sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flower daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered yellow flowers with white ray florets. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with similar climates.
